conclusion: Understanding mechanics of ball on ring with rope using static equilibrium and trigonometry
Ball is on a vertically fixed smooth ring with a rope tied to it
Identify forces: tension force F and gravitational force acting on the ball
Sum of forces must be zero since ball is in static state; tension force F is the only external force
Tension force F equals vertical component of gravitational force
Vertical component of gravitational force is F = mg * sin(theta)
Tension force F equals mg * sin(theta)
Substitute values to find F: F = 10 * 10 * sin(30 degrees) = 50
